formElement.label: Configuration Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: Wsadmin Absolute Path:
formElement.documentation: Path to wsadmin. If the location of wsadmin is in the PATH environment variable, then just the script name can be specified omitting its full path. E.g. '/path/to/wsadmin.sh' or 'wsadmin.bat'.

formElement.label: Connection Type:
formElement.documentation: Specifies to type of connection to use to connect to the application server that you want to administer. The valid choices are SOAP, RMI, and NONE. Default is SOAP.

formElement.label: Scope:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the scope in which the mail session supports installed mail applications.For example, 'Cell=Cell01,Node=Node01,Server=server1' or 'Cell=Cell01,ServerCluster=testCluster'

formElement.label: Mail Session Name:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the administrative name of the JavaMail session object.

formElement.label: Mail Session Description:
formElement.documentation: Specifies optional description for mail session.

formElement.label: Mail Session JNDI Name:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the Java Naming and Directory Interface (JNDI) name for the resource, including any naming subcontexts.

formElement.label: Category:
formElement.documentation: Optional string to use while classifying or grouping the resources.

formElement.label: Enable Debug Mode?:
formElement.documentation: Select to print the interaction between mail application and mail server as well as the properties of this mail session to System.Out.log file.

formElement.label: Outgoing Mail Server:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the host name of server that is accessed when sending mail.

formElement.label: Outgoing Mail Server Port:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the port of the server that is accessed when sending mail.

formElement.label: Outgoing Mail Server Protocol:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the protocol to use when sending mail.

formElement.label: Outgoing Mail Server Credential:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the user of the mail account when the outgoing mail server requires authentication.

formElement.label: Return E-mail Address :
formElement.documentation: Represents the Internet email address that, by default, displays in the received message in the From or the Reply-To address. The recipient's reply will come to this address.

formElement.label: Incoming Mail Server:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the host name server that is accessed when receiving mail.

formElement.label: Incoming Mail Server Port:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the port of the server that is accessed when receiving mail.

formElement.label: Incoming Mail Server Protocol:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the protocol to use when receiving mail.

formElement.label: Incoming Mail Server Credentials:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the credential for the mail account when the incoming mail server requires authentication.

formElement.label: Enable Strict Internet Address Parsing?:
formElement.documentation: Specifies whether the recipient addresses must be parsed in strict compliance with RFC 822.
